notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability. For more information, see the CVE pages listed in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3 GA includes security updates. For more information, see the release notes listed in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* graphql-java: DoS by malicious query (CVE-2022-37734)

* snakeyaml: Denial of Service due missing to nested depth limitation for collections. (CVE-2022-25857)

* snakeyaml: Uncaught exception in org.yaml.snakeyaml.composer.Composer.composeSequenceNode (CVE-2022-38749)

* snakeyaml: Uncaught exception in org.yaml.snakeyaml.constructor.BaseConstructor.constructObject (CVE-2022-38750)

* snakeyaml: Uncaught exception in java.base/java.util.regex.Pattern$Ques.match (CVE-2022-38751)

* snakeyaml: Uncaught exception in java.base/java.util.ArrayList.hashCode (CVE-2022-38752)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgements, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3 security update

branches.name: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3

product.name: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3
product.product_id: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3

notes.text: A flaw was found in the org.yaml.snakeyaml package. This flaw allows an attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) due to missing nested depth limitation for collections.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: snakeyaml: Denial of Service due to missing nested depth limitation for collections
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
For RHEL-8 it's downgraded to moderate because "snakeyaml" itself in RHEL 8 or RHEL-9 isn't shipped and "prometheus-jmx-exporter" is needed as build dependency. And it's not directly exploitable, hence severity marked as moderate.
Red Hat Integration and AMQ products are not vulnerable to this flaw, so their severity has been lowered to moderate.
Red Hat Single Sign-On uses snakeyaml from liquibase-core and is only used when performing migrations and would require administrator privileges to execute, hence severity marked as Low.
Red Hat Fuse 7 is now in Maintenance Support Phase and details about its fix should be present soon. However, Red Hat Fuse Online (Syndesis) does will not contain the fix for this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

fixed: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link for the update. You must be logged in to download the update.
product_ids: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3

products: Red Hat build of Eclipse Vert.x 4.3.3

vulnerabilities.title: snakeyaml: Denial of Service due to missing nested depth limitation for collections

notes.text: A flaw was found in GraphQL Java. This flaw allows an attacker to use a malicious query in GraphQL to cause a denial of service due to inefficient lexer input validation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: graphql-java: DoS by malicious query
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in the snakeyaml package due to a stack-overflow in parsing YAML files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted file, a remote attacker could cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: snakeyaml: Uncaught exception in org.yaml.snakeyaml.composer.Composer.composeSequenceNode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Build of Quarkus is not affected by this issue as it already includes the fixed version.

Satellite component Candlepin does not directly use snakeyaml, so it is not affected. Regardless, an update with the latest, unaffected snakeyaml version will be provided at next release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
